Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate a healthy plant that has received enough water.
The student can illustrate a plant that shows signs of not having enough water (e.g., wilting or browning leaves).
The student can show a comparison between a healthy plant and a plant lacking water.
The student can use patterns in their drawing to demonstrate that plants need water to live and grow.
The student can use their drawing to describe how a lack of water affects plants based on their observations.
